intro: Orellana, commonly known as the "flower of the Andes," is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. Orellana has lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, fragrant blooms. It is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its cultural significance in local communities.
